resource.chars: et n°53 a sereni0 g u at es langie op geit ick lever
No63 te wagen sijnde om de laken packen int generael verlegen boven
al voor no 64: 67: 68
30 maij
rotterdam abranm de bra
in antwort aenden u.l van 27 deser seer tegen onse verwachting
en tegen gewoonte hebben die van costi de voijagi van hul coot
gemackt, vant mijn vrinden de montr kent die mij dienen
als dan is
schrijven 20 deser uyt londen, dat sij
geen tjdinge hadden
van het arrivement van de schop het convoije van costi tot sul
oft sulcke nau een eacusie is en dat sij van mijn packen niet hebben
doen laeden oft wat daer van 1s en can ick niet tedencken omdat
u.l seght van mijn merck te vinden maer de nomsters niet
nochtans sijne mijne packen de eerste van al tot hul geweest, en
ben nochal in hope dat u.l eenige der selve sal gevonden hebben
waer naer seer verlange anders soude ick wel mallerens sijn soo
gedient te worden, oversulcke bidde morgen mij het gepasseert
te laten weten, als mede wanneereen convoije naer londen vertreckt
omdat een van mijne vrinden soude geerne medegaen, biddende
den ingeslotene gelieft voorts ganck te geven.
amsterdam geeraert rovers
in antwort aen duwe van 26 en 28 deser ter wijlen uwe
de gecochte wollen met mijne geremitteerde £360 niet can betaelen
soo remitteere u.l ingeslotene £325: ten laet de wed. a fonterini 4 spniak.
voor
de rekeninge foute van tijdt noch niet naergesien de £100 st
soo uwe mij remitteert ten laste abraham naan a 30 5 ½ ae uwe
ten dancke gecreditteert, en sal van de voorschreve £360 peravontuer
door een den secunde, anders disponeren, der halven gelieft die brief
van costi
voor mijn ordre te bewaeren. tot hul waren 3 sa convoijers gearrive
ieder met 36 stucken waer mede voor mij eenige packen verwachte
godt geve sij een soo corte rijse mogen doen als die van rotterdam
de welcke int gaen en comen geen 3 weken en hebbe doende
geweest. hun arrivement verneme geerne, en wat wijders in de
wissel sal voorvallen
london walter en willem kent
sence mij last toy ou ontfe 23 cout receaued yonos ƒ3 & 10d
have much worch to understand your expressions of the latter about ship
pinge att hull for Rott & that you hoard nothing yett of that convoy
& that there will be butt vere few ships y you will take in cloth
because they can not get men & what signifies all this the men that
brought the ships from rott to hull can bring them to Rott a gaine
the goods must not be shipped in english may be in dustch vessels hadv
you no notice of that convoj, how come so manney of your packs of your
mark of to arrive with them & not one of my numbers though my
stackes have been of the first att hull t'is of if you strided to
d'estroy my wharchouse, thatt convoy arrived att Rott 24 cur &
others shall have their goods & I nothing, I doe all I can to have my
goods timeley bought & you bhincke not to observe anney appritinitie
of shippinge though you had no order in particular tiss in gennerale
to losse no opportunitie of good convoyes & can a better be then 3 a 4
man of warr & when ever you magine a scrupule gett ensped what you
feare may be questioned & you so doeing for the best I'll alwayes allow
the ensusance rather then to loose good opportunitie of convoy & hon
wee can have no advise of beeng shipped I have I beleave writt 100
times & more not to venter above £200:- in one bottem or 2 packes
one of bayes & one of kestes & nover a pack of cloth by another butt
alwayes cloth by itt self & 2 packes of white ware & yett you now sereple
& in Colthurst you did not so I say again 2 packes of white ware im
one bottem & one pack of cloth in an other att hull, to have omitted this
convoij & if you ship butt 3 packes for Amst what will, become of the
rest, therefore ship all what remaine for Amst, for god knowes
when an other convoy should present & by that time must have more
goods, I have much writting with you about that shipping & you forgett
what is past & I am looser ly ist itt makee mee warde of the trade &
this veces mee more then tis worth, what signifres 5 packes in aconvoy
all my studre is to hate wish all opportunitie something b lott this
before all times as I so often repeated the convoj from london is arrived
att ostend proceed buyinge the rest of the spar clothes ship with
first for Amst or Rott as writt before principally of the clothes orderes
12 curt I shall pay the £12 att 30 p I wish you had drawen £1200:-
att that prize when ever you meet soo anhazard draw on mee much or
litble inclosed £100:- on Abraham nathan procure the needfull gett
the rest of my goods att hull by time & ship as best you can non
they have so good convoy & sumer wheather so litt le feare loose nes
op portunisie att london to sond a pack of spans clothes for holland
provide the reds cottons flannels pack whithe for the first convoy
for ostend I rest
iusy
London richard Southell
In answer to your of 3 & 7 cur the convoy & ship from londen
arrived att ostend, you have credit for the 3 packs sent there will
buutt amonghst the spans cloths I cespeddeiore modish, att lales
some of the as cullours & no so manney graye yett lett tle wanting
ull be bought, though of 6 pence a yeard more then ordred & buy
no more grayes for by your patt these look to broad mixt I exspee
ted att least 5 pack whites EE yeall mach soo lett them be for
the first convoy the flannels as alsoo the cottons for all which
I suppox pou have now 5 weecke time. & hope that interim you
markitts will be stored to your content & that you shall finde the
same in thed nord yett convoy bange there now could wish part
there of come there with therein pray doe all you can for there is
3 men of warr for Amst & god be knowes when other convoy shill
present inclosed remitt you £130:- drre 4 june in the Govonen
of the banck in Engeland procure the needfrull & advise what pase
for when shall have receawe your goods shell order more
